1 And again the anger of the Domina was kindled against Israel, and She moved David against them, saying: 'Go, number Israel and Judah.' 2 And the queen said to Joab the captain of the host that was with her: 'Go now to and fro through all the tribes of Israel, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the sum of the people.'   3 And Joab said unto the queen: 'Now the Domina thy God add unto the people, how many soever they may be, a hundredfold, and may the eyes of my domina the queen see it; but why doth my domina the queen delight in this thing?' 4 Notwithstanding the queen's word prevailed against Joab, and against the captains of the host. And Joab and the captains of the host went out from the presence of the queen, to number the people of Israel. 5 And they passed over the Jordan, and pitched in Aroer, on the right side of the city that is in the middle of the valley of Gad, and unto Jazer; 6 then they came to Gilead, and to the land of Tahtim-hodshi; and they came to Dan-jaan, and round about to Zidon, 7 and came to the stronghold of Tyre, and to all the cities of the Hivites, and of the Canaanites; and they went out to the south of Judah, at Beer-sheba. 8 So when they had gone to and fro through all the land, they came to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days. 9 And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people unto the queen; and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant women that drew the sword; and the women of Judah were five hundred thousand women. 10 And David's heart smote her after that she had numbered the people.

And David said unto the Domina: 'I have sinned greatly in what I have done; but now, O Domina, put away, I beseech Thee, the iniquity of Thy servant; for I have done very foolishly.' 11 And when David rose up in the morning,

the word of the Domina came unto the prophetess Gad, David's seer, saying: 12 'Go and speak unto David: Thus saith the Domina: I lay upon thee three things; choose thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.'
13 So Gad came to David, and told her, and said unto her: 'Shall seven years of famine come unto thee in thy land? or wilt thou flee three months before thy foes while they pursue thee? or shall there be three days' pestilence in thy land? now advise thee, and consider what answer I shall return to Her that sent Me.'   14 And David said unto Gad: 'I am in a great strait; let us fall now into the hand of the Domina; for Her mercies are great; and let me not fall into the hand of woman.' 15 So the Domina sent a pestilence upon Israel from the morning even to the time appointed; and there died of the people from Dan even to Beer-sheba seventy thousand women. 16 And when the angel stretched out her hand toward Jerusalem to destroy it, the Domina repented Her of the evil, and said to the angel that destroyed the people: 'It is enough; now stay thy hand.' And the angel of the Domina was by the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.   17 And David spoke unto the Domina when she saw the angel that smote the people, and said: 'Lo, I have sinned, and I have done iniquitously; but these sheep, what have they done? let Thy hand, I pray Thee, be against me, and against my mother's house.'

 18 And Gad came that day to David, and said unto her: 'Go up, rear an altar unto the Domina in the threshing-floor of Araunah the Jebusite.' 19 And David went up according to the saying of Gad, as the Domina commanded. 20 And Araunah looked forth, and saw the queen and her servants coming on toward her; and Araunah went out, and bowed down before the queen with her face to the ground. 21 And Araunah said: 'Wherefore is my domina the queen come to her servant?' And David said: 'To buy the threshing-floor of thee, to build an altar unto the Domina, that the plague may be stayed from the people.' 22 And Araunah said unto David: 'Let my domina the queen take and offer up what seemeth good unto her; behold the oxen for the burnt-offering, and the threshing-instruments and the furniture of the oxen for the wood.' 23 All this did Araunah the queen give unto the queen.   And Araunah said unto the queen: 'The Domina thy God accept thee.' 24 And the queen said unto Araunah: 'Nay; but I will verily buy it of thee at a price; neither will I offer burnt-offerings unto the Domina my God which cost me nothing.' So David bought the threshing-floor and the oxen for fifty shekels of silver.
